MASTER_PAD_VERSION_INFO.MASTER_PAD_INFO: Portable Application Description, or PAD for short, is a data set that is used by shareware authors to disseminate information to anyone interested in their software products. To find out more go to http://www.asp-shareware.org/pad

Program_Info.Program_Name: Dave's Quick Search Taskbar Toolbar Deskbar

English.Keywords: search, taskbar, deskbar, toolbar, google, calculator, clock, translator, currency, dictionary, thesaurus, quotes, news, yahoo, quick, dave, dqsd, open source, gpl
English.Char_Desc_45: Dave's Quick Search Taskbar Toolbar Deskbar
English.Char_Desc_80: Dave's Quick Search Deskbar launches Google, Yahoo, and dozens of other searches
English.Char_Desc_250: Dave's Quick Search Deskbar launches Google, Yahoo, Switchboard, and dozens of other searches from your desktop taskbar. It is simple yet powerful: from a single tiny textbox it also works as a calculator, clock, translator and currency converter.
English.Char_Desc_450: Dave's Quick Search Deskbar launches Google, Yahoo, Switchboard, and dozens of other searches directly from your desktop taskbar. You type your search and hit Enter for a regular Google search. If you're feeling lucky, tack an exclamation point on to the end of your search - "pow!" - and go directly to the top ranked hit. The interface is fast, simple, and powerful: it also works as a calculator, clock, translator and currency converter.
English.Char_Desc_2000: Dave's Quick Search Deskbar is a tiny textbox that Dave Bau designed for search hounds with weary mouse-fingers. Unlike the Google Toolbar, this little deskbar lets you launch searches without starting a web browser first, directly from your desktop taskbar. You type your search and hit Enter for a regular Google search. If you're feeling lucky, tack an exclamation point on to the end of your search - "pow!" - and go directly to the top ranked hit. It is Powered By Google, and Yes it Really Works. Now you can do searches no matter what you are doing - email, word processing, programming, whatever. There's more. You're not a captive to Google. Do Yahoo searches with a "question?", get Merriam-Webster definitions with a "colon:", get Bloomberg stock quotes like this "msft intc csco$", and find Switchboard phone numbers by saying "Lois Lane#". You can search real "news." search "newsgroups," check "weather*", or "comparison shop$$". There's a built in calculator when you need to know "pow(1.0625, 30)" is 6.1640785. There's a currency converter when you need to know "100 usd>gbp" at current rates, and a translator to help you read "algunas palabras es-en". And so on. Too much to remember? Under IE 5.5 or better there's a little menu that shows you all your choices. Not enough space on your deskbar? It includes a clock so that you can free up some space by turning off the system deskbar clock. Missing a feature you need? If you know HTML and want to add your own functionality, you can - it is distributed under GPL. It'll make you super-quick. You'll be ready to take on the world and surf like never before.

Simtel.Simtel_WinXX_Category: Internet - webbrows Web Page / Browser Utilities
